refnamediv.refpurpose: Write signals and arrays to an hdf5 file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: hdf5write writes N signals and arrays to a specified hdf5 file.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: hdf5write ifilename, xout1[, xout2, xout3, ..., xoutN]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ifilename -- the hdf5 file's name (in double-quotes). If the file does not exist it will be created.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: xout1,... xoutN -- signals or arrays to be written to the hdf5 file. This opcode accepts i-rate, k-rate, a-rate signals or i-rate, k-rate, a-rate arrays of any dimension. These signals or arrays are written to a dataset within the hdf5 file using the same variable name as in Csound. For example, if the Csound variable is called 'ksignal', then the name of the hdf5 dataset is 'ksignal'. Any number and multiple types of datasets may be written at a time.
